years as a radio talk-show host, Mike Pence started a TV show in 1995. Although Mike Pence was inspired by conservative talk-show host Rush Limbaugh , he kept to his "no personal attacks" pledge. Conservative media, including Rush Limbaugh , have a tremendous blind spot when it comes to making a distinction between differences in public policy and personal differences, Mike Pence told The Indianapolis Star in 1995. When David McIntosh , who succeeded Phil Sharp , decided to run for governor in 2000, Mike Pence won a six-way primary for the GOP nomination in the east-central Indiana district.

Richard Lugar Prather, a retired auto worker from Anderson, said after the Pendleton town hall that he believed Mike Pence 's reputation as a federal spending hawk would serve him well running for the governor's office. I think he would have been a good candidate for president, but I'm glad he didn't, Prather said. "In the next race, he can run for president."
